text.0: come hither o ye sons of strength ye Ṛbhus stay not afar ye children of sudhanvan.
text.1: at this libation is your gift of treasure let gladdening draughts approach you after indras.
text.2: hither is come the Ṛbhus gift of riches here was the drinking of the wellpressed soma.
text.3: since by dexterity and skill as craftsmen ye made the single chalice to be fourfold.
text.4: ye made fourfold the chalice that wag single ye spake these words and said o friend assist us.
text.5: then vājas gained the path of life eternal defthanded Ṛbhus to the gods assembly.
text.6: out of what substance was that chalice fashioned which ye made fourfold by your art and wisdom.
text.7: now for the gladdening draught press out the liquor and drink o Ṛbhus of die meath of soma.
text.8: ye with your cunning made your parents youthful the cup for gods to drink ye formed with cunning.
text.9: with cunning Ṛbhus rich in treasure fashioned the two swift tawny steeds who carry indra.
text.10: whoso pours out for you when days are closing the sharp libation for your joy o vājas.
text.11: for him o mighty Ṛbhus ye rejoicing have fashioned wealth with plenteous store of heroes.
text.12: lord of bay steeds at dawn the juice thou drankest thine only thine is the noonday libation.
text.13: now drink thou with the wealthbestowing Ṛbhus whom for their skill thou madest friends o indra.
text.14: ye whom your artist skill hath raised to godhead have set you down above in heaven like falcons.
text.15: so give us riches children of sudhanvan o sons of strength ye have become immortal.
text.16: the third libation that bestoweth treasure which ye have won by skill ye dexteroushanded.
text.17: this drink hath been effused for you o Ṛbhus  drink it with high delight with joy like indras.
